intro: Calonyction comospermum, commonly known as the silky thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features a tall, branching stem covered in soft, silvery hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. It produces purple to pink flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
